issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

fields.summary: WebHdfsFileSystem.getFileStatus() won't return correct "snapshot enabled" status

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: WebHDFS - Adding "snapshot enabled" status to ListStatus query result.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: FSOperations.toJsonInner() doesn't check the "snapshot enabled" bit. Therefore, "fs.getFileStatus(path).isSnapshotEnabled()" will always return false for fs type HttpFSFileSystem/WebHdfsFileSystem/SWebhdfsFileSystem. Additional tests in BaseTestHttpFSWith will be added to prevent this from happening.

comments.body:
Really good catch. Thanks [~smeng]

One minor issue: please close FileSystem objects at the end of the test. Other than that the patch looks good.
Thanks [~jojochuang] for the comment. Added code to close fs at the end of the test in rev 002.

Test failures seem related. Would you please check? [~smeng]

[~jojochuang] Yes those two would fail because the test cases also relies on HDFS-13838.

Sorry that I forgot to mention this earlier. Linked HDFS-13838 as the blocking Jira.

Submitted rev 003 to change HttpFS client SNAPSHOT_BIT_JSON from "seBit" to "snapshotEnabled" to make it compatible with WebHDFS.

This jira is still blocked by HDFS-13838 because getFileStatus() depends on JsonUtilClient .toFileStatus() to get the "snapshot enabled" bit. Jenkins is expected to fail on BaseTestHttpFSWith tests before HDFS-13838 is committed.
